title: 3 Ways for Women to Wear a Belt

steps.title: Opt for thin belts that elongate your frame.
steps.content: Opt for thin belts that elongate your frame. Thin belts that don’t cover up your midsection will give you the appearance of a longer torso. The elongating effect will be all the more apparent if you choose a belt that matches the color of the pants or skirt you’re wearing. [1] X Research source Thin belts are especially great for petite women who are looking to not overpower their stature.

steps.title: Go with an embellished, colorful belt to show off your daring style.
steps.content: Go with an embellished, colorful belt to show off your daring style. A brightly-colored belt with embellishments can be used to add a fun touch to an otherwise plain outfit. There’s many different kinds of embellishments to glam-up your style. You can go for brightly-colored rhinestones, studs, or intricate embroidery. [2] X Research source Embellished belts will look great with your favorite pair of medium-wash jeans and a neutral colored blouse. If you’re wearing a bold belt, tuck in your blouse or shirt to place more focus on the fun accessory.

steps.title: Choose a subtle, neutral-toned belt if you’re going for a sophisticated style.
steps.content: Choose a subtle, neutral-toned belt if you’re going for a sophisticated style. Dark and neutral colored belts will slim you down and accentuate your figure. This is a great style for curvy women who want to create an hourglass shape. [3] X Research source If your belt has a gold-colored buckle, consider wearing gold jewelry. The same goes for silver. [4] X Expert Source Chloée Ohayon-Crosby Costume Designer & Wardrobe Specialist Expert Interview. 23 October 2020.

steps.title: Opt for wide belts if you have an athletic shape.
steps.content: Opt for wide belts if you have an athletic shape. Athletic women look great in wide belts because they help create curves. The accessory can be paired with a blouse that has a collar in order to add some extra shape to the top half of the body. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Find a belt in which the metal notch fits in the center hole.
steps.content: Find a belt in which the metal notch fits in the center hole. A belt that allows for the tail to lie flat against your body is a good fit for you. If the leftover length is any shorter, it could look stubby and ill-fitting. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Knot a cloth belt for a casual look.
steps.content: Knot a cloth belt for a casual look. Long cloth belts knotted at the waist are a great everyday option. They’re very comfortable to wear because they don’t have any extra hardware that could dig into your skin. [7] X Research source Make sure the belt is long enough that it doesn’t stick out of your body at an odd angle. [8] X Research source For a relaxed look, add a knotted belt to a band T-shirt and distressed jeans.

steps.title: Belt a cardigan below your bustline for chilly days.
steps.content: Belt a cardigan below your bustline for chilly days. This is a versatile look that can be relaxed when worn with a maxi skirt, but can easily transition into everyday office wear if it’s paired with a pencil skirt. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Add a belt to your favorite pair of denim shorts for hot days.
steps.content: Add a belt to your favorite pair of denim shorts for hot days. Denim shorts worn with a thin belt are a great style for a day at the park. Pair this with a comfortable T-shirt for a fast and easy summer look. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a romper belted at the waist for a fashionable style.
steps.content: Wear a romper belted at the waist for a fashionable style. Keep the outfit casual by opting for a neutral-toned belt and flip-flops. This is a great outfit for a day spent at the beach with friends. A bright, floral romper with a brown belt would be a good fashion choice for summer days.

steps.title: Choose to wear mismatched belt and shoes for a fun twist.
steps.content: Choose to wear mismatched belt and shoes for a fun twist. Go for contrasting colors that still look great together if you’re after a more casual look. This gives a sense of a modern and youthful woman. [11] X Research source A red belt paired with boyfriend jeans and gold flats would look great on anyone!

steps.title: Belt a heavy wool coat for winter.
steps.content: Belt a heavy wool coat for winter. A long coat, paired with a thick belt that accentuates your waist, is an elegant way to style the accessory. This is fashionable, but still practical enough to keep you warm during the winter months. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Opt for belting a form fitting dress for a going-out look.
steps.content: Opt for belting a form fitting dress for a going-out look. This will give you an hourglass shape and increase the visual interest of the outfit. This style would look great with a dress that has a pencil-skirt style bottom. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Pair a black dress with a thick belt and heels for a classy outfit.
steps.content: Pair a black dress with a thick belt and heels for a classy outfit. This is the perfect outfit for an elegant dinner party or a special trip to a sophisticated restaurant. [14] X Research source Add a clutch to elevate the look.

steps.title: Choose to wear a bright belt with a monochromatic jumpsuit.
steps.content: Choose to wear a bright belt with a monochromatic jumpsuit. A belt at the waist of an all monochromatic outfit is flattering and stylish. This looks best when wearing an entire outfit in a neutral color because the belt adds a fun touch. [15] X Research source Pair the look with some fun heels for a party.

steps.title: Belt a full, high-waisted skirt for a polished look.
steps.content: Belt a full, high-waisted skirt for a polished look. Paired with a tucked in blouse, it creates a sleek style that’s still youthful and figure-flattering. When worn with tights, it can easily transition into a fall and winter outfit. [16] X Research source
